alert.note: Alert for Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 3:10PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN TAOS AND EAST CENTRAL RIO ARRIBA COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 309 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tres Piedras, or 20 miles west of Questa, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tres Piedras. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 381 and 390. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 219 and 234. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley
